title: (x) Ketel One font - Bradley {Justin}
content: okay i get cheezed off when people wonder what font a company used for it's logo, but over the holidays i saw ketel one ads that were set all in the same font they use for their logo. i'm figuring that it is a custom font that they must have had developed, but is there any chance that it's not?
author: pablohoney77

comments.content: It has some of the same flavour as [Honda](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/honda/)

Here's a scan of "Bradley" from a Solotype book. Looks pretty close...   
   
 ![Bradley](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25998.gif)

I was just about to post a much less complete sampling of Bradley. I'm glad you beat   
me to it with a full alphabet image Justin.   
   
According to Luc Devroye's listing of fonts on the various Dover Dan X. Solo books/CDs,   
Bradley may be found on the [24 Celtic and Medieval Display Fonts CD-ROM](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0486999602/qid=1076285090/ref=sr_8_xs_ap_i1_xgl14/103-1448097-5990211?v=glance&s=books&n=507846).
i was thinking it was honda too, then i saw the ad again and realized it wasn't quite the same. i knew you would come thru for me. thnx guys!

hey mike, what's this listing that you mentioned earlier about solotype fonts? i'm looking for a font that was in his catalog that i've been working on, nymphic (maybe you've seen my post on that one) i keep hoping i'll find it in one of the dover font books, but no luck yet.

Paul,   
 [Luc Devroye's font pages](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/fonts.html) are an incredible resource. Several of the specialty   
font link pages contain the listing you seek.   
   
Scroll down to the Dover Press entry on [this page](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/fraktur.html), for example. The listing is   
for the books with CDs of 24 fonts only. Unfortunately, you won't find Nymphic   
listed. I would think that Nymphic ('tis a beauty, eh?) would appear in one of   
those 100 Fonts books of theirs, especially the [Victorian](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0486233022/qid=1076344340/sr=1-1/ref=sr_1_1/103-1448097-5990211?v=glance&s=books) one.   
   
BTW, I'm the one who exchanged posts with you on MyFonts and via e-mail   
about Nymphic awhile ago. I'm waiting patiently for your digitization! Perhaps   
Solotype will beat you to it, though, now that Mr Solo is [releasing fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/solotype/?itemsperpage=29&resultcount=29&page=1&mode=alpha) on   
MyFonts.

oh hey mike! good to hear from you again. did you see my string on Nymphic letterforms elsewhere on this site? you can see what letters i have thus far there. i see that my fonts does have solotype fonts now, but i wonder if they aren't just the fonts that he released on his dover cd series. i haven't looked into it that deeply yet. i bought a couple of the solotype books on your suggestion, but unfortunately Nymphic wasn't in the 100 Victorian fonts book. So I've been looking for someone who has an original specimen book that could scan it for me or something, so that one's on the back burner a bit. anyhow i'll keep you posted.

You mean the [vodka](http://web.archive.org/web/20110526211112/http:/www.ketelone.com/home.html)?Can you show us a sample   
or provide a link to an online showing?
